item.title: Ethereum, a Virtual Currency, Enables Transactions That Rival Bitcoin's
item.description:
Ethereum, a Virtual Currency, Enables Transactions That Rival Bitcoin's

All of this work is still very early. The first full public version of the Ethereum software was recently released, and the system could face some of the same technical and legal problems that have tarnished Bitcoin. Many Bitcoin advocates say Ethereum will face more security problems than Bitcoin because of the greater complexity of the software.

item.title: Decentralized Autonomous Organizations: Ethereum Sparks Up Googles of Tomorrow
item.description:
Decentralized Autonomous Organizations: Ethereum Sparks Up Googles of Tomorrow

The recent rise of Ethereum has brought a wave of new users and enthusiasm into its possible applications. While smart contracts and their benefits are nothing new to the community one of the more disruptive use cases, DAOs have not been explored to the extent they deserve.

item.title: IBM Urges Government to Adopt Blockchain Technologies
item.description:
IBM Urges Government to Adopt Blockchain Technologies

On March 16, 2016, Jerry Cuomo, IBM Fellow and Vice President of Blockchain Technologies was asked to testify on a panel before the United States Government House Energy and Commerce Subcommittee on Commerce, Manufacturing & Trade. For more on IBM's involvement with blockchain, go to: ibm.com/blockchain. The subcommittee was looking into disruptive technologies.

item.title: Bitnation - The virtual country | Shift
item.description:
Bitnation - The virtual country | Shift

Online activists have founded a virtual state called Bitnation. The decentralized organization is designed as an alternative to traditional states. There are no limits, and a wide range of options. More from this edition of Shift: http://www.dw.com/en/shift-living-in-the-digital-age-2016-03-14/e-19073006-9798

item.title: Blockchain Technology and Decentralized Governance: Is the State Still Necessary? by Marcella Atzori :: SSRN
item.description:
Blockchain Technology and Decentralized Governance: Is the State Still Necessary? by Marcella Atzori :: SSRN

This paper aims to fill this gap and it discusses the key points of blockchain-based decentralized governance, which challenges to varying degrees the traditional mechanisms of State authority, citizenship and democracy.

item.title: Estonian e-Residency and BitNation launch new Public Notary in 'Blockchain Jurisdiction'
item.description:
Estonian e-Residency and BitNation launch new Public Notary in 'Blockchain Jurisdiction'

The Estonian e-Residency program in collaboration with BITNATION are launching a new Public Notary using Blockchain technology to e-Residents valid in 'blockchain jurisdiction'. The World Blockchain media outlet, CoinTelegraph, investigated what is at the roots of this project.

item.title: Government urged to use Bitcoin-style digital ledgers - BBC News
item.description:
Government urged to use Bitcoin-style digital ledgers - BBC News

The UK's chief scientific adviser has urged the government to adopt the technology that powers crypto-currency Bitcoin to run various public services. Bitcoins are powered by blockchains - digital ledgers that record information from Bitcoin transactions to DNA. Sir Mark Walport has argued that they could be used by government departments as a more secure way of managing data.

item.description:

item.title: How the Blockchain Could Change Everything for the Legal Vertical
item.description:
How the Blockchain Could Change Everything for the Legal Vertical

In the future, we may see disputes over assets decided in transnational digital arbitration in virtual jurisdictions like BitNation, a â€œvirtual nation" that provides nation-state services via the blockchain.
